intro: Boehmeria diversiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles, highlighting its economic and cultural significance.
